item.title: Reuters reveals JetBlue, Spirit near takeover deal
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters was first to report that Frontier Group’s $2.7 billion acquisition of Spirit Airlines would collapse after the latter let […]

The post Reuters reveals JetBlue, Spirit near takeover deal appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded: The post Reuters reveals JetBlue, Spirit near takeover deal appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals U.S. weighs resumption of offensive arms sales to Saudis
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively revealed the Biden administration is discussing possibly lifting its ban on U.S. sales of offensive weapons to Saudi […]

The post Reuters reveals U.S. weighs resumption of offensive arms sales to Saudis appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively revealed the Biden administration is discussing possibly lifting its ban on U.S. sales of offensive weapons to Saudi Arabia, but any final decision is expected to hinge on whether Riyadh makes progress toward ending the war in neighboring Yemen. Senior Saudi officials pressed their U.S. counterparts to scrap a policy of selling only defensive arms to its top Gulf partner in several meetings in Riyadh and Washington in recent months. 

The post Reuters reveals U.S. weighs resumption of offensive arms sales to Saudis appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Baidu in talks to sell majority stake in iQIYI, China’s answer to Netflix
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters was first to report that China’s internet search engine giant Baidu is in talks to sell its controlling stake […]

The post Reuters reveals Baidu in talks to sell majority stake in iQIYI, China’s answer to Netflix appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report that China’s internet search engine giant Baidu is in talks to sell its controlling stake in iQIYI, China’s answer to Netflix, in a deal that could value all of iQIYI at about $7 billion. Baidu, which owns 53% of iQIYI and holds more than 90% of its shareholder voting rights, plans to sell all its holdings in the Chinese video streaming services firm. 

The post Reuters reveals Baidu in talks to sell majority stake in iQIYI, China’s answer to Netflix appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Evergrande discussing staggered payments, debt-to-equity swaps for $19 bln offshore bonds
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported that China Evergrande Group is considering repaying offshore public bondholders owed around $19 billion with cash installments […]

The post Reuters reveals Evergrande discussing staggered payments, debt-to-equity swaps for $19 bln offshore bonds appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported that China Evergrande Group is considering repaying offshore public bondholders owed around $19 billion with cash installments and equity in two of its Hong Kong-listed units, as the world’s most indebted developer struggles to emerge from its financial crisis. Evergrande’s entire $22.7 billion worth of offshore debt, including loans and private bonds, is deemed to be in default after missing payment obligations late last year. The company said in March that it will unveil a preliminary debt restructuring proposal by the end of July.

The post Reuters reveals Evergrande discussing staggered payments, debt-to-equity swaps for $19 bln offshore bonds appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Japanese buyout firms JIP, Polaris considering bids for Toshiba
item.dc:creator: Ramisa Tasnim
item.description:
Reuters revealed that Japanese buyout firms Japan Industrial Partners and Polaris Capital Group are each considering participating in bids for […]

The post Reuters reveals Japanese buyout firms JIP, Polaris considering bids for Toshiba appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters revealed that Japanese buyout firms Japan Industrial Partners and Polaris Capital Group are each considering participating in bids for Toshiba Corp. Toshiba, which has been bedeviled by accounting and governance crises since 2015, set up a special committee last month to explore strategic options, including potential deals to go private, after shareholders voted down a management-backed restructuring plan.

The post Reuters reveals Japanese buyout firms JIP, Polaris considering bids for Toshiba appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Germany, Qatar at odds over terms in talks on LNG supply deal
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters revealed that Germany and Qatar have hit difficulties in talks over long-term liquefied natural gas (LNG) supply deals amid differences over […]

The post Reuters reveals Germany, Qatar at odds over terms in talks on LNG supply deal appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters revealed that Germany and Qatar have hit difficulties in talks over long-term liquefied natural gas (LNG) supply deals amid differences over key conditions, including the duration of any contract. Germany, which aims to cut its carbon emissions by 88% by 2040, is reluctant to commit to Qatar’s conditions to sign deals of at least 20 years to secure the massive LNG volumes it needs to reduce its dependence on Russian gas.

The post Reuters reveals Germany, Qatar at odds over terms in talks on LNG supply deal appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Canada in talks with Repsol, Pieridae Energy about LNG export terminals
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters reported exclusively that the Canadian government is in discussion with the companies behind two proposed east coast liquefied natural gas export […]

The post Reuters reveals Canada in talks with Repsol, Pieridae Energy about LNG export terminals appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters reported exclusively that the Canadian government is in discussion with the companies behind two proposed east coast liquefied natural gas export facilities to see how it can speed up the projects and help boost supply to Europe. Natural Resources Minister Jonathan Wilkinson told Reuters the government was looking at Spanish company Repsol’s LNG facility in New Brunswick and the Goldboro LNG facility in Nova Scotia proposed by Pieridae Energy. 

The post Reuters reveals Canada in talks with Repsol, Pieridae Energy about LNG export terminals appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals German gas importer VNG to transfer euros to Russia for payment
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters exclusively revealed Germany’s VNG will transfer euro payments for Russian gas to Gazprombank in the future and expects no problems during a […]

The post Reuters reveals German gas importer VNG to transfer euros to Russia for payment appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively revealed Germany’s VNG will transfer euro payments for Russian gas to Gazprombank in the future and expects no problems during a conversion to roubles, meeting Moscow’s key demands under a fresh payment scheme. VNG’s first detailed comments on the matter come as European buyers of Russian gas must navigate a new set of rules Moscow has imposed to pay for its most precious commodity, most notably a demand to pay in roubles via an elaborate scheme.

The post Reuters reveals German gas importer VNG to transfer euros to Russia for payment appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Biden announces new $150 million weapons package for Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters was first to report that President Joe Biden would sign a new weapons package worth at least $100 million for Ukraine, […]

The post Reuters reveals Biden announces new $150 million weapons package for Ukraine appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters was first to report that President Joe Biden would sign a new weapons package worth at least $100 million for Ukraine, the latest in a series of transfers to help Kyiv repel Russia’s invasion. The United States has rushed $3.4 billion worth of armaments to Ukraine since Russia invaded on Feb. 24, including howitzers, anti-aircraft Stinger systems, anti-tank Javelin missiles, ammunition and recently-disclosed “Ghost” drones.

The post Reuters reveals Biden announces new $150 million weapons package for Ukraine appeared first on Reuters News Agency.

item.title: Reuters reveals Brookfield taps banks to sell out of French towers firm TDF
item.dc:creator: Jaime-Lee Charles
item.description:
Reuters exclusively reported Canada’s Brookfield Asset Management is working with banks to sell its 45% stake in French towers firm TDF Group as […]

The post Reuters reveals Brookfield taps banks to sell out of French towers firm TDF appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
item.content:encoded:
Reuters exclusively reported Canada’s Brookfield Asset Management is working with banks to sell its 45% stake in French towers firm TDF Group as it seeks to capitalize on growing demand for key infrastructure assets across Europe. Brookfield has drafted in Citigroup and Credit Suisse to work on the sale which could value TDF at more than 5 billion euros.

The post Reuters reveals Brookfield taps banks to sell out of French towers firm TDF appeared first on Reuters News Agency.
